elements.description:
`` is a Web Component for text field control in forms. ```html ``` ### Prefixes and suffixes These are child elements of a `` that are displayed inline with the input, before or after. In order for an element to be considered as a prefix, it must have the slot attribute set to `prefix` (and similarly for `suffix`). ```html
Sent to:
@vaadin.com
``` ### Styling The following custom properties are available for styling: Custom property | Description | Default ----------------|-------------|------------- `--vaadin-text-field-default-width` | Set the default width of the input field | `12em` The following shadow DOM parts are available for styling: Part name | Description ----------------|---------------- `label` | The label element `input-field` | The element that wraps prefix, value and suffix `value` | The text value element inside the `input-field` element `error-message` | The error message element The following state attributes are available for styling: Attribute | Description | Part name -------------|-------------|------------ `disabled` | Set to a disabled text field | :host `has-value` | Set when the element has a value | :host `has-label` | Set when the element has a label | :host `invalid` | Set when the element is invalid | :host `input-prevented` | Temporarily set when invalid input is prevented | :host `focused` | Set when the element is focused | :host `focus-ring` | Set when the element is keyboard focused | :host `readonly` | Set to a readonly text field | :host See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description:
Whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.
List of available options at:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-autocomplete

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.description:
This is a property supported by Safari that is used to control whether
autocorrection should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
on: Enable autocorrection.
off: Disable autocorrection.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.description:
This is a property supported by Safari and Chrome that is used to control whether
autocapitalization should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
characters: Characters capitalization.
words: Words capitalization.
sentences: Sentences capitalization.
none: No capitalization.

properties.name: autoselect
properties.description: Specify that the value should be automatically selected when the field gains focus.

properties.name: clearButtonVisible
properties.description: Set to true to display the clear icon which clears the input.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Error to show when the input value is invalid.

properties.name: i18n
label
properties.description: String used for the label element.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: Minimum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: This attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Specifies that the user must fill in a value.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The initial value of the control.
It can be used for two-way data binding.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: This property is set to true when the control value is invalid.

properties.name: hasValue
properties.description: Specifies that the text field has value.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.description:
When set to true, user is prevented from typing a value that
conflicts with the given `pattern`.

properties.name: list
properties.description:
Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.
The value must be the id of a <datalist> element in the same document.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description:
A regular expression that the value is checked against.
The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Message to show to the user when validation fails.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: _stateChanged
methods.description: of the clear button instead of setting display property for it depending on state.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description: Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

methods.name: validate
methods.description:
Returns true if `value` is valid.
`<iron-form>` uses this to check the validity or all its elements.

return.desc: True if the value is valid.

and the value is cleared using the clear button.

events.name: iron-resize

elements.description:
`<vaadin-password-field>` is a Web Component for password field control in forms.

```html
<vaadin-password-field label="Password">
</vaadin-password-field>
```

### Styling

See vaadin-text-field.html for the styling documentation

In addition to vaadin-text-field parts, here's the list of vaadin-password-field specific parts

Part name       | Description
----------------|----------------------------------------------------
`reveal-button` | The eye icon which toggles the password visibility

In addition to vaadin-text-field state attributes, here's the list of vaadin-password-field specific attributes

Attribute    | Description | Part name
-------------|-------------|------------
`password-visible` | Set when the password is visible | :host

See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

on: Enable autocorrection.
off: Disable autocorrection.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
This is a property supported by Safari and Chrome that is used to control whether
autocapitalization should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
characters: Characters capitalization.
words: Words capitalization.
sentences: Sentences capitalization.
none: No capitalization.

attributes.name: autoselect
attributes.description: Specify that the value should be automatically selected when the field gains focus.

attributes.name: clear-button-visible
attributes.description: Set to true to display the clear icon which clears the input.

attributes.name: error-message
attributes.description: Error to show when the input value is invalid.

attributes.name: i18n
label
attributes.description: String used for the label element.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Maximum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: Minimum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: This attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Specifies that the user must fill in a value.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The initial value of the control.
It can be used for two-way data binding.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: This property is set to true when the control value is invalid.

attributes.name: has-value
attributes.description: Specifies that the text field has value.

attributes.name: prevent-invalid-input
attributes.description:
When set to true, user is prevented from typing a value that
conflicts with the given `pattern`.

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the user commits a value change.

events.name: input
events.description:
Fired when the value is changed by the user: on every typing keystroke,
and the value is cleared using the clear button.

events.name: iron-resize
events.description: Fired when the text-area height changes.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-email-field>` is a Web Component for email field control in forms.

```html
<vaadin-email-field label="Email">
</vaadin-email-field>
```

### Styling

See vaadin-text-field.html for the styling documentation

See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description:
Whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.
List of available options at:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-autocomplete

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.description:
This is a property supported by Safari that is used to control whether
autocorrection should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
on: Enable autocorrection.
off: Disable autocorrection.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.description:
This is a property supported by Safari and Chrome that is used to control whether
autocapitalization should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
characters: Characters capitalization.
words: Words capitalization.
sentences: Sentences capitalization.
none: No capitalization.

properties.name: autoselect
properties.description: Specify that the value should be automatically selected when the field gains focus.

properties.name: clearButtonVisible
properties.description: Set to true to display the clear icon which clears the input.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Error to show when the input value is invalid.

properties.name: i18n
label
properties.description: String used for the label element.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: Minimum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: This attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Specifies that the user must fill in a value.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The initial value of the control.
It can be used for two-way data binding.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: This property is set to true when the control value is invalid.

properties.name: hasValue
properties.description: Specifies that the text field has value.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.description:
When set to true, user is prevented from typing a value that
conflicts with the given `pattern`.

properties.name: list
properties.description:
Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.
The value must be the id of a <datalist> element in the same document.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description:
A regular expression that the value is checked against.
The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Message to show to the user when validation fails.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: _stateChanged
methods.description: of the clear button instead of setting display property for it depending on state.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description: Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

methods.name: validate
methods.description:
Returns true if `value` is valid.
`<iron-form>` uses this to check the validity or all its elements.

return.desc: True if the value is valid.
